intro: Thesium laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Thesium laevigatum is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
